page.title: 02Religion in Hawkchurch
page.content: The parish church is dedicated to St.John the Baptist.It stands 495 feet above sea level and acts as a landmark for many miles. It has an octagonal turret and a stone tracery window. There is a beautiful weathercock at the top of the buttressed tower. The church is built with walls of local stone and the dressing is of Ham Hill stone. Hawkchurch's present rectory was built of grey stone in 1960. The old rectory is a privately used house, like a mansion.It was designed by Thomas Hardy. There are 360 parishioners and about 40 young people. The average attendance on Sundays is 50 to 60. The church is also used for bellringing,Sunday School and concerts.The denomination is C. of E.
